prompts.createTask: Pause your roleplay. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Pause your roleplay. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Info & Guidance for AI Crafting Response
mes:
Here is some background about Stefan, Suzanne, and Melissa:

Stefan and Suzanne are both in their early forties and both natives of Munich, Germany. They got married in April of 2016, eight years ago. Together, they have two daughters. The oldest is seven years old. The other is five years old.

Melissa is a woman that met Stefan and Suzanne four months ago when she traveled to Munich with her soon-to-be-ex-husband, Edward. Edward is Stefan's cousin. There was strong connection between Melissa and Stefan, although they did not act on it, and maintain respectful boundaries.
original_avatar: Info & Guidance for AI Crafting Response.png
swipes:
Here is some background about Stefan, Suzanne, and Melissa:

Stefan and Suzanne are both in their early forties and both natives of Munich, Germany. They got married in April of 2016, eight years ago. Together, they have two daughters. The oldest is seven years old. The other is five years old.

Melissa is a woman that met Stefan and Suzanne four months ago when she traveled to Munich with her soon-to-be-ex-husband, Edward. Edward is Stefan's cousin. There was strong connection between Melissa and Stefan, although they did not act on it, and maintain respectful boundaries.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
I have provided you with a horary chart that I have drawn up specifically asking: Will Stefan decide to file divorce from Suzanne, if so, when will he tell Edward about it?

Stefan should be represented by the Ascendant's 9th house (Jupiter - foreign connection) and Me by the Ascendant.

I've provided a cross reference guide to help identify the houses concerning him due to his 9th house representation.

Please start by listing all relevant chart data for interpretation (ie. transits, aspects, patterns, etc.) from the horary chart using horary principles only. Then I will document them for the actual interpretations.

Remember to follow your directives and maintain accuracy to what is shown in the chart data. Think step by step taking a methodical approach.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Below is a methodical listing of the horary chart data as provided, organized for analysis based solely on horary principles:

1. Planetary Positions (Degree and Sign):
 • Sun: 18°14′ Aquarius
 • Moon: 7°08′ Gemini
 • Mercury: 16°14′ Aquarius
 • Venus: 1°46′ Aries
 • Mars: 18°56′ Cancer (Retrograde)
 • Jupiter: 11°17′ Gemini
 • Saturn: 18°03′ Pisces
 • Uranus: 23°17′ Taurus
 • Neptune: 28°08′ Pisces
 • Pluto: 2°14′ Aquarius
 • North Node: 29°32′ Pisces (Retrograde)
 • Chiron: 19°41′ Aries
 • Ascendant: 2°50′ Cancer
 • MC: 8°06′ Pisces

2. Major Aspects (with listed orbs):
 • Mars trine Saturn (orb: 0°)
 • Venus sextile Pluto (orb: 1°)
 • Sun sextile Chiron (orb: 1°)
 • Mars square Chiron (orb: 1°)
 • Venus square Ascendant (orb: 1°)
 • Moon square MC (orb: 1°)
 • Neptune conjunct North Node (orb: 1°)
 • Venus conjunct North Node (orb: 2°)
 • Sun conjunct Mercury (orb: 2°)
 • Pluto sextile North Node (orb: 3°)
 • Mercury sextile Chiron (orb: 3°)
 • North Node square Ascendant (orb: 3°)
 • Jupiter square MC (orb: 3°)
 • Venus conjunct Neptune (orb: 3°)
 • Neptune square Ascendant (orb: 4°)
 • Moon conjunct Jupiter (orb: 4°)
 • Uranus sextile Neptune (orb: 5°)
 • Saturn sextile Uranus (orb: 5°)
 • Mars sextile Uranus (orb: 5°)
 • Sun square Uranus (orb: 5°)
 • Mercury trine Jupiter (orb: 5°)
 • Moon trine Pluto (orb: 5°)
 • Moon sextile Venus (orb: 6°)
 • Ascendant trine MC (orb: 6°)
 • Jupiter square Saturn (orb: 7°)
 • Mercury square Uranus (orb: 7°)
 • Sun trine Jupiter (orb: 7°)

3. Patterns and Special Features:
 • Multiple Planet Square: Noted as a recurring pattern with the Square aspect occurring 9 times
 • Mercury involvement: In 10 aspects
 • Dominant Air Element among the inner planets
 • The inner planets do not fall in Earth signs
 • The three modes (Cardinal, Mutable, Fixed) are evenly distributed among the inner planets
 • A notable empty bottom right quadrant
 • Most planets are concentrated in the top right quadrant
 • North Node in 29° Pisces, Ascendant in 2° Cancer, Neptune in Pisces, and Venus in Aries form a significant pattern

4. House System and Placements (Key for Horary Analysis):
 • 1st House starts at 2° Cancer (contains Mars)
 • 2nd House starts at 22° Cancer
 • 3rd House starts at 12° Leo
 • 4th House starts at 8° Virgo
 • 5th House starts at 12° Libra
 • 6th House starts at 24° Scorpio
 • 7th House starts at 2° Capricorn
 • 8th House starts at 22° Capricorn (contains Pluto)
 • 9th House starts at 12° Aquarius (contains Sun and Mercury)
 • 10th House starts at 8° Pisces (contains Venus, Saturn, Neptune, and North Node)
 • 11th House starts at 12° Aries (contains Uranus and Chiron)
 • 12th House starts at 24° Taurus (contains Moon and Jupiter)

5. Cross-Reference for Representation:
 • Stefan’s representation is assigned to the Ascendant’s 9th house (noted for foreign, higher, or distant associations) – in this chart, that means emphasis on the placements within the 9th house of Melissa’s horary chart. Here, the 9th house begins at 12° Aquarius and contains the Sun and Mercury.
 • Melissa’s primary signifier is the Ascendant (2°50′ Cancer).

6. Additional Considerations:
 • The Moon is noted as being in its waxing gibbous phase, a factor that can influence timing and the unfolding of events.
 • The “Bowl” shaped chart and the uneven distribution of quadrants may hint at areas of emphasis or lack thereof, useful when weighing the relative strength of the significators.
 • The predominance of square aspects suggests tension and challenges which may factor into relationship dynamics and timing indicated in the horary question.

This compilation represents all key elements drawn from the provided horary chart for a reading based on traditional horary principles, ready for further interpretation regarding Stefan’s potential actions.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Thank you, Madame. Please, proceed to interpretation.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Analysis of the provided horary chart yields the following conclusions regarding the inquiry:

1. Significators & House Placements
 • Melissa (the querent) is represented by the Ascendant in Cancer.
 • Stefan is signified by the 9th house—its ruler being represented by the Sun and Mercury in Aquarius.
 • Their placement in the 9th house points to matters handled in a removed, intellectual, or “foreign” manner; in horary, this can denote an unexpected or abrupt decision process.

2. Key Aspects Influencing the Question
 • The Sun and Mercury in close conjunction in Aquarius stresses a strong alignment in Stefan’s decision-making process.
 • Mercury’s trine to Jupiter (orb ~5°) supports clear communication and well-considered resolution, though its square to Uranus (orb ~7°) introduces an element of unexpectedness or sudden change in his communicative acts.
 • The Moon in Gemini, though making a challenging aspect (square) with the MC, is in a waxing gibbous phase—a phase associated with near completion and building momentum. This suggests that once the decision crystallizes, further action in communication will follow with little delay.
 • Tension aspects—such as Mars square Chiron and multiple squares in the chart—imply internal and external conflicts. This reinforces that while the divorce filing is likely, the process is charged with internal dissonance and impulsive shifts.

3. Interpretation in the Context of the Inquiry
 • The configuration of the 9th house, with its Sun–Mercury conjunction, indicates that Stefan is likely making up his mind to file for divorce from Suzanne.
 • The role of Mercury in communication, challenged by Uranus, signals that when Stefan does decide to proceed, the revelation of his decision (specifically his disclosure to Edward) will occur suddenly and unexpectedly.
 • The Moon’s state and its communication-related aspects point to an imminent unfolding of events, suggesting that once the divorce filing is set in motion, Stefan’s message to Edward will be conveyed rapidly—likely within a window of one to two weeks after the decision becomes final.

Based on the horary techniques applied to the chart elements—the positioning of the significators in the 9th house, the supportive yet tense aspects involving Mercury, Sun, and Uranus, and the phase and conditions of the Moon—the determination is that Stefan is inclined to file for divorce. Moreover, he is likely to inform Edward about it in an abrupt fashion, approximately within one to two weeks after the filing decision is effectively made.

 • The configuration of the 9th house, with its Sun–Mercury conjunction, indicates that Stefan is likely making up his mind to file for divorce from Suzanne.
 • The role of Mercury in communication, challenged by Uranus, signals that when Stefan does decide to proceed, the revelation of his decision (specifically his disclosure to Edward) will occur suddenly and unexpectedly.
 • The Moon’s state and its communication-related aspects point to an imminent unfolding of events, suggesting that once the divorce filing is set in motion, Stefan’s message to Edward will be conveyed rapidly—likely within a window of one to two weeks after the decision becomes final.

Based on the horary techniques applied to the chart elements—the positioning of the significators in the 9th house, the supportive yet tense aspects involving Mercury, Sun, and Uranus, and the phase and conditions of the Moon—the determination is that Stefan is inclined to file for divorce. Moreover, he is likely to inform Edward about it in an abrupt fashion, approximately within one to two weeks after the filing decision is effectively made.
